citation.article-title: Roseivivax halodurans gen. nov., sp. nov. and Roseivivax halotolerans sp. nov., aerobic bacteriochlorophyll-containing bacteria isolated from a saline lake.

p.s: Roseivivax (Ro.se.i.vi'vax. M.L. adj. roseus rose-coloured, pink; L. adj. vivax living; M.L. masc. n. Roseivivax pink living organism)
Cells are aerobic and Gram-negative rods that are motile by means of subpolar flagella.
Bacteriochlorophyll a is synthesized under aerobic conditions.
The ubiquinone system is Q-10 (Nishimura et al., 1994).
The major cellular fatty acids are C18:1 (Nishimura et al., 1994).
The type species is Roseivivax halodurans.
